content.question: The integral test can be used to determine that which of the following statements about the infinite series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator e raised to the fraction 1 over n, power, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?

choices.label: The series converges because <math alttext="the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator e raised to the fraction 1 over x, power, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, equals, negative 1 plus e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series converges because <math alttext="the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator e raised to the fraction 1 over x, power, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, equals e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series converges because <math alttext="the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator e raised to the fraction 1 over x, power, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, equals 1 minus e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series diverges because <math alttext="the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator e raised to the fraction 1 over x, power, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is not finite.

content.answer: The series converges because <math alttext="the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator e raised to the fraction 1 over x, power, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, equals, negative 1 plus e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
